result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Juana R Rivas

defendant.name: Rivas, Juana R
defendant.address: 526 S Wisconsin St Apt 8, Elkhorn, WI 53121

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Juana R Rivas in court.  Attorney Jason Daane for Grace Hagerman in court for Juana R Rivas.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by ADA Vivien TenHaken. Called @ 3:15 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for status conference on 22CM420 and initial appearance on 22CM543. Record by Atty. Daane as to new file. Waives reading, enters not guilty pleas, and reserves all rights. Court sets all matters over for status.
Status conference scheduled for December 15, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Defendants Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.
records.descr: Notice of motion and motion for discovery

records.addlTxt: Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt: Signed bond filed with the court.

TOTAL BOND - CASES 22GF963 & 22CM420Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH VICTIM, O.S. D.O.B. 01-13-1979 OR HIS RESIDENCEDefendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant Juana R Rivas appeared by video, in custody. ADA JJ Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Grace Hagerman appears with defendant on both files. Called @ 1:19 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for bond hearing on 22GF963 with 22CM420 tracking new charges. Discussion as to bond.  State requests prior bond be forfeited and new bond be set. Response by Atty. Hagerman who asks that the current bond cover the new charges as well. 
Response by the Court who forfeits prior bond and sets new total bond:

TOTAL BOND 22GF963 & 22CM420.
$10,000.00 signature 
NO contact with the victim, O.S. (d.o.b. 01-13-1979), or his residence.

Discussion as to concerns regarding competency. Court read the letter submitted from Atty. Hagerman and orders competency examination.

Matter set out about 30 days for report.

Court in recess.
Hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Notice of Arrest w/ narrative update
